scenarioDescription:
The G 9-40 Exoplanetary System


Overview

G 9-40 is a star with 0.29 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.31 times its radius. It is located 91.09 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 9.9 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

G 9-40 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the G 9-40 system


G 9-40 b

G 9-40 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2020-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of G 9-40 b is 4.770 times the mass of Earth. The radius of G 9-40 b is 2.025 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.15, and a semi-major axis of 0.0385 astronomical units, G 9-40 b could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system G 9-40, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: G 9-40 - System With 1 Exoplanet
